Welcome to Cloud2Gether! This guide will help you set up your account and start automating your DevOps workflows with AI-powered agents.
Prerequisites Before you begin, make sure you have:
A Cloud2Gether account (sign up here) Access to at least one cloud provider (AWS, Azure, or GCP) Administrative permissions to create API keys or service accounts Quick Start Overview Create your account — Sign up and verify your email Connect a cloud provider — Add credentials for your infrastructure Deploy your first agent — Launch an AI agent to manage your resources Issue your first command — Tell the agent what to do What’s Next? Installation Set up Cloud2Gether CLI and configure your local environment. [Learn more →](installation/) Quick Start Deploy your first agent and run your first automation in 5 minutes. [Learn more →](quickstart/) Core Concepts Understand the key concepts behind Cloud2Gether's agentic approach. [Learn more →](concepts/) Need Help? Check our FAQ for common questions Join our community on Discord Contact support@cloud2gether.com

title: Getting Started

body:
What is Agentic DevOps? Traditional DevOps requires engineers to write scripts, configure tools, and manually orchestrate workflows. Agentic DevOps takes a different approach: AI agents that understand your intent and figure out how to achieve it.
Instead of writing:
# Traditional: You write the how - name: Deploy application hosts: production tasks: - docker_image: ... - docker_container: ... You say:
Deploy my application to production with zero downtime The agent handles the implementation details.
Key Concepts Agents Agents are AI-powered workers that manage your infrastructure. Each agent:
Has specific capabilities (infrastructure, security, cost, etc.) Maintains context about your environment Can execute actions on your behalf Learns from your infrastructure patterns Agents are not just chatbots — they’re autonomous workers that can:
Monitor your infrastructure continuously Take proactive actions based on policies Alert you to issues before they become problems Execute complex multi-step workflows Workspaces A Workspace is an isolated environment containing:
Connected cloud providers Deployed agents Configuration and policies Team members and permissions Most organizations use one workspace per environment (dev, staging, production) or per team.
Providers Providers are the cloud platforms Cloud2Gether connects to:
AWS — EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, EKS, and 200+ services Azure — VMs, Storage, Functions, AKS, and more GCP — Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, GKE Kubernetes — Any cluster, managed or self-hosted Custom — Connect any API via provider plugins Actions Actions are operations agents can perform:
Action Type Examples Query List resources, check status, analyze costs Modify Create, update, delete resources Monitor Watch for changes, alert on thresholds Automate Schedule tasks, create workflows Actions have built-in safety:
Destructive operations require confirmation All actions are logged and auditable Policies can restrict what agents can do Policies Policies define guardrails for agent behavior:
# Example policy name: production-safety rules: - action: delete resources: ["*"] require: approval - action: modify resources: ["database/*"] require: approval - action: query resources: ["*"] allow: true Policies ensure agents operate within boundaries you define.
How Agents Work ┌─────────────┐ ┌─────────────┐ ┌─────────────┐ │ You │────▶│ Agent │────▶│ Cloud │ │ (Intent) │ │ (AI) │ │ Provider │ └─────────────┘ └─────────────┘ └─────────────┘ ▲ │ │ │ ▼ ▼ │ ┌─────────────┐ ┌─────────────┐ └─────────────│ Response │◀────│ Results │ │ (Human) │ │ (Data) │ └─────────────┘ └─────────────┘ You express intent — Natural language describing what you want Agent interprets — AI understands the goal and plans steps Agent executes — API calls to your cloud providers Results returned — Human-readable summary of what happened Agent Types Cloud2Gether provides specialized agents for different tasks:
Agent Type Purpose Infrastructure Manage compute, storage, networking Security Audit, compliance, vulnerability scanning Cost Optimization, budgeting, waste detection Deployment CI/CD, releases, rollbacks Monitoring Observability, alerting, incident response Learn more in the AI Agents documentation.
Security Model Cloud2Gether is designed with security first:
Least privilege — Agents only access what they need Audit logging — Every action is recorded Encryption — All data encrypted in transit and at rest No data storage — We don’t store your infrastructure data SOC 2 compliant — Enterprise-grade security practices See Security & Compliance for details.
Next Steps Now that you understand the concepts:
Deploy more agents Configure policies Set up team access
